intro: Rinorea astrolabes, commonly known as the star-shaped rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often branched. Rinorea astrolabes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
